definition: how old are you? (familiar, or to a child)
variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)

sentences.english: I am a divorced and have a teenaged daughter.
sentences.chinese: 我离异，有一个十几岁的女儿。

sentences.english: How old were you when you started learning singing?
sentences.chinese: 你开始学习唱歌时几岁了？

sentences.english: Perfect husbands switch careers in their mid-50’s.
sentences.chinese: 完美的丈夫在50几岁换工作。

sentences.english: But the primary goal of the teen years is to achieve independence.
sentences.chinese: 不过，十几岁这个年龄的首要目标就是要争取独立。

sentences.english: Assange fathered him in his teens with his then-girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 阿桑格与他当时的女友在十几岁时就当上了爹妈。

sentences.english: What's the worst thing that can happen for a teenage girl?
sentences.chinese: 一个十几岁的女孩身上能发生最坏的事情是什么呢？

sentences.english: Teenagers like to hot-rod down our street.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的年轻人喜欢在我们的街道上开飞车。

sentences.english: As the hot days, a group of bigger friends were swimming.
sentences.chinese: 由于天很热，有一群比我们大几岁的哥哥在游泳。

sentences.english: Say nothing of, how old are who didn't break-up.
sentences.chinese: 说真的没有什么的，都几岁了谁没分手过。

sentences.english: Many children outgrow absence seizures in their teen years.
sentences.chinese: 许多儿童患者在十几岁时可自愈。

sentences.english: Could you find a teenager to mow the lawn?
sentences.chinese: 能不能找个十几岁的少年来帮你除草？

sentences.english: When is a child old enough to stay home alone?
sentences.chinese: 小孩要几岁才够大到可以独自在家？

sentences.english: How old are most suitable for hydrocele surgery?
sentences.chinese: 鞘膜积液几岁动手术最适合？

sentences.english: It’s aimed at teens, they say, and the creator is here.
sentences.chinese: 他的创造者说，他们的目标人群是十几岁的孩子们。

sentences.english: When I was a few years older, I experienced another kind of magic.
sentences.chinese: 当我大几岁以后，我经历了另一种神奇。

sentences.english: Two teens were injured playing chicken in their cars.
sentences.chinese: 两个十几岁的少年在比赛飞车时受了伤。

definition: variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
peer/one's contemporary/person of the same age
to be in the prime of life

one's age, according to the traditional Chinese method of reckoning (i.e. the number of Chinese calendar years in which one has lived). In this system, a person's age is one year at birth, and increases by one year at the beginning of the first solar term 立春[Li4 chun1] each year, rather than on one's birthday./as opposed to 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]/see also 實歲|实岁[shi2 sui4]
to not be wiser despite being older/to be older than (you) by (humble)
method of calculating a person's age in years from birth/see also 虛歲|虚岁[xu1 sui4]/see also 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]
